title: 'Cheap sensationalism': Mahieka photographed inappropriately; Pandya hits out at paparazzi
description: Hardik Pandya strongly condemned paparazzi for intrusive photography of Mahieka Sharma, calling it disrespectful and cheap sensationalism. He urged the media to be more mindful and respect boundaries, emphasising that not everything needs to be captured. Meanwhile, Pandya is nearing a T20I milestone of 2,000 runs and 100 wickets.

However, a devastating fire at a Goa outlet, which killed 25, exposed alleged safety violations and a lack of oversight, sparking public outrage and questions of accountability for the Luthra brothers.

description: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', featuring Ranveer Singh and a stellar cast, has taken the box office by storm, crossing ₹100 crore in its opening weekend. The film witnessed impressive growth, with Sunday collections soaring to ₹43 crore. While Monday saw a natural dip, the movie continues to perform strongly, accumulating ₹129.

description: A parliamentary standing committee has highlighted repeated disruptions in major NTA exams, including UGC-NET, CSIR-NET, NEET-PG, NEET-UG, CUET and JEE Main. The panel recommended a shift towards pen-and-paper testing, citing successful CBSE and UPSC models, and urged that CBTs be held only in government-controlled centres. It also called for a nationwide blacklist of tainted vendors and advised using NTA’s Rs 448-crore surplus to strengthen internal exam capabilities and regulatory systems.

IndiGo must submit a revised schedule soon. Other airlines like Air India and Akasa also saw schedule reductions. SpiceJet, however, increased its operations.

Sandhu's match-winning cameo in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy earned him this unique endorsement, potentially boosting his profile ahead of the IPL 2026 auction.

He assured that passenger convenience and dignity are being protected, and long-term measures are in place to enhance India's aviation sector, emphasizing no airline will be permitted to inconvenience passengers.

Harbhajan insists the team should be built around these proven match-winners. He argues that sidelining them for youth could be detrimental in crucial matches.

Right to Disconnect Bill 2025: What it means for employees in India - explained
description: India’s Right to Disconnect Bill 2025 empowers employees to ignore work communications outside official hours without facing penalties. Introduced by NCP MP Supriya Sule, the bill proposes an Employees’ Welfare Authority to monitor compliance, investigate complaints, and impose fines on non-compliant firms. Similar laws exist in France, Italy, Portugal, and Australia, ensuring work-life balance, while the U.S. lacks comprehensive protections. The legislation addresses burnout, digital overload, and the need for clear boundaries between professional and personal life.

title: Pakistan-supported terror attacks, tensions with China part of new class 7 NCERT textbook
Nick Fuentes defends using racist slur against Usha Vance — watch
description: Far-right commentator Nick Fuentes faced scrutiny from Piers Morgan for racist remarks targeting Second Lady Usha Vance's Indian heritage. Fuentes defended his comments by claiming supporters of JD Vance are racist and that he was highlighting hypocrisy. He previously mocked a Thanksgiving photo of Vance's family, making disparaging remarks about their Indian heritage.

Despite existing high tariffs, Indian rice exports to the US remain strong, particularly premium basmati. Experts suggest this is election-season messaging, as increased duties would primarily impact American consumers and not significantly harm Indian exporters.

Jitesh Sharma is tipped for the number seven spot. Pandya's availability allows for preferred spin options without compromising batting depth.

title: 'Bacchey bade ho jate hain': Wasim Akram takes dig at IPL duration, calls PSL No.1

He cited the Big Bash League's shift to a shorter window as evidence, emphasizing the PSL's bowling depth and competitive edge.

title: Gabrielle Union says she and Dwyane Wade 'weren’t in a good place' when he fathered a child
description: Gabrielle Union has opened up about the devastation she felt when Dwyane Wade fathered a child with another woman during a brief breakup in 2013. Despite the trauma, the couple worked through the issue, with Wade admitting their marriage isn't perfect and requires ongoing effort. They reunited and married in 2014.

title: Want to use your old smartphone as a home security camera? How to set it up
description: Transform your old smartphone into a home security camera with a simple app. This cost-effective DIY solution allows you to monitor your home, children, or pets remotely. By installing a security app on your old phone and your current device, you can set up a functional surveillance system. While convenient, be aware of limitations compared to professional cameras.

title: Tim Pool reports shooting at his home as podcast-related controversy escalates
description: Tim Pool reported shots fired at his West Virginia home on December 5, hours after a podcast episode featuring Milo Yiannopoulos made unverified claims about Erika and Charlie Kirk. Pool's security team is reviewing footage, and he suggested the incident was meant to intimidate. Authorities have not yet confirmed the shooting.
